abstractContent.text: This paper proposes an elaboration of the Generative Lexicon (GL) in Puste-jovsky (1995) based on a survey of BC-CWJ (2009).
I manually classified the Japanese NP 1-no NP 2 "NP 1 's NP 2 " construction in accordance with semantic relations between the two nominals.

The result indicates the need for the expansion of GL for computing the meaning of the NP 1-no NP 2 construction by incorporating ref-erential module, as I call, that predicates temporary location, time, and manner of the referent.
For example, in ima-no nihon "the present Japan," ima-no modifies the time of the event argument in the referen-tial module.
